Articles.Content:
On 2/23/2019 at 11:14 PM, infinite_monkey said:

Still having problems with the SL-1 landing legs. I'm not sure if it's a problem with KJR. Anyway, it says "Autostrut Locked: Heaviest Part". Is that intended?

I'm working on tuning the strength of them now! Don't know of any other problem, except they can flicker sometimes when extending.


For the offset shrouds bug,  I traced it down to a change in ModuleJettison in KSP v1.4.5. Unfortunately I haven't been able to find a work around yet... There is some hope as the 2 stock parts that have the same situation (ModuleJettison + ModuleAnimateGeneric) are not affected by it. However, despite loading those models into blender I haven't been able to figure out what I am doing differently then those ones.

v1.8.4:
* Strengthened the SL-1 landing legs. They should now stay more extended under weight.
One of my fave mods by far when it comes to making probes. Any chance for a way to remove the checkered flag on the reentry sphere though?

On 4/7/2019 at 10:11 PM, Raccoon said:

One of my fave mods by far when it comes to making probes. Any chance for a way to remove the checkered flag on the reentry sphere though? 

Thanks!

Sure, that could be an optional part variant! =)
This looks positively wonderful! In fact, all of your mods fill major niches I had.

Considering the nice hinges and similar now available in Breaking Grounds, I might as well remove the robotic parts from this mod.

Or does anyone see a reason not to? =)

14 minutes ago, Katten said:

Considering the nice hinges and similar now available in Breaking Grounds, I might as well remove the robotic parts from this mod.

Or does anyone see a reason not to? =)

you could have an MM patch that hides them if the DLC is installed but since robotics are not base game I don't see why any such parts should be removed

@Katten, have you looked at how the SOAP cameras interact with the scenery since v1.7.X?  I tried out the SOAP-1 on Kerbin and the Mun, in KSP v1.7.2 x64, and the scenery in a picture gets cut off beyond a certain distance, plus there's also no sky in the image (more specifically, no skybox I think).  I landed on the Mun, and I got a pic of some hills under a blank blue background.

Interestingly enough, when I launch off the Mun to about 10km up, I can capture an image of the skybox, but not the surface of the Mun or Kerbin on the horizon.

I think Squad re-did the Stock skybox in 1.7.X and it may be more than just better image detail.

Really cool mod!

One thing, would you consider updating the parts list in the OP as there are a lot of parts in the mod that aren't listed there
Support for 1.7.x ? I'm pretty sure but no one updates their mods titles

23 minutes ago, SeucheAnemone56 said:

Support for 1.7.x ? I'm pretty sure but no one updates their mods titles

I believe everything is working, and yes, I should get around to test and update it. Hopeful for some more time and energy =)

Actually, with the exception of some visual parts that have had problems since 1.4.x somewhere. Wish I could find a good workaround to continue focusing on further development of parts!

Edited September 21, 2019 by Katten

Just now, Katten said:

I believe everything is working, and yes, I should get around to test and update it. Hopeful for some more time and energy =)

The developement of this great mod is more important than any description. Thanks for all your efforts

Tested in 1.7.3 and most stuff looks okey. Some previously existing issues continue to do so...
* the extra visual meshes that appear automatically when connecting some parts together, and are correctly visible in the VAB, continue to end up in the wrong place in flight. 
* the cameras don't record all layers of meshes, so for example Kerbin will not be shown from orbit - only the the stars
* sometimes the cameras will make part of the world darker until you have taken a photo, like the renderer has been messed up a bit

Edited September 28, 2019 by Katten
Is this 1.9.1 compatible and still being managed?

On 6/29/2020 at 4:33 PM, KIMCHI said:

Is this 1.9.1 compatible and still being managed?

v.1.8.5

* Updated it on CKAN to indicate compatibility with KSP v1.4 - v1.10 =)

Edited July 15, 2020 by Katten
This mod is so good. Love the lore, too!

On 7/19/2020 at 4:50 PM, doggonemess said:

This mod is so good. Love the lore, too!

Pics or it didn't happen :p

I am loving this mod. 

Those two little cameras ... maybe there could be a way that they would generate science points for, at least, the first  5 or 6 pictures? It would make it more fun to use on rovers/landers etc.

37 minutes ago, Daniel Prates said:

Those two little cameras ... maybe there could be a way that they would generate science points for, at least, the first  5 or 6 pictures? It would make it more fun to use on rovers/landers etc.

Keep an eye on this for when @linuxgurugamer finishes reviving it:

It has a science experiment for cameras that can be patched to work with others. I recall using it with Hullcam back in the day

The batteries are missing on some of the parts.

Also, it seems that the ablator and decouplers are missing too.

Sadly, Rocket Emporium with Animated attachement makes for really mean duo in my campaign - adding those made some of decoupler joints wobbly like jello (despite KJR) and strangely cloned advanced options tab (1.10.1)

Looks like this mod in its own \Plugins directory duplicates files form KSP\KSP_x64_Data\Manged\ Removing: Assembly-CSharp-firstpass.dll, Assembly-CSharp.dll, TDx.TDxInput.dll, UnityEngine.dll, UnityEngine.UI.dll fixes some problems

You also can fix (at least partially) wobbliness  editing AnimatedAttachment.cfg, making it works only with parts provided by Rocket Emporium but it doesn't fix bad shroud rendering and other small annoyances

Edited December 6, 2020 by Ravien
partial solution

On 12/6/2020 at 12:44 AM, Ravien said:

 

Oh no, did I include the dlls by mistake... again... sorry! 

Yeah the shroud issue is so annoying, it was something changed in 1.4.x I think. It happens on stuff that has a combo of animations and shrouds. It should be possible to solve, because there is one or two standard parts that have this, but I've spent too much time trying to find a solution and given up at this stage =S
Does this work on 1.11 yet?

hey @Katten I've discovered the latest version 1.8.5 under KSP 1.10.1 breaks the settings menu. It shows an Advanced Options (1) and Advanced Options (2) and if you click on either it selects both and shows double options and breaks the UI. Tested with stock + both DLC and no other mods except MM

Hey,

Did somebody resolve the aforementioned problems?
